briefdescription.para: Validates the form, returns true if it is valid, false otherwise. This behaves as a normal submit event, but returns the result.

simplesect.para: Validates a single element, returns true if it is valid, false otherwise. This behaves as validation on blur or keyup, but returns the result.

parameterdescription.para: An element to validate, must be inside the validated form.

simplesect.para: Show the specified messages. Keys have to refer to the names of elements, values are displayed for those elements, using the configured error placement.

parameterdescription.para: One or more key/value pairs of input names and messages.

briefdescription.para: Resets the controlled form. Resets input fields to their original value (requires form plugin), removes classes indicating invalid elements and hides error messages.

Returns the number of invalid fields. This depends on the internal validator state. It covers all fields only after validating the complete form (on submit or via $("form").valid()). After validating a single element, only that element is counted. Most useful in combination with the invalidHandler-option.

simplesect.para: Add a compound class method - useful to refactor common combinations of rules into a single class.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the class rule to add

briefdescription.para: Add a custom validation method. It must consist of a name (must be a legal javascript identifier), a javascript based function and a default string message.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the method, used to identify and referencing it, must be a valid javascript identifier
The actual method implementation, returning true if an element is valid

(Optional) The default message to display for this method. Can be a function created by jQuery.validator.format(value). When undefined, an already existing message is used (handy for localization), otherwise the field-specific messages have to be defined.
